isis.stitle: CALIPER DISC BRAKES - MAINTENANCE - BRAKE PADS

svcproc.title: BRAKE PADS
svcproc.para: To inspect brake pads for wear, position vehicle on floor stands and remove tire and wheel assemblies.Visually inspect the pad lining by checking each visible end and inspecting through the opening of the caliper assembly. If lining thickness at the thinnest point appears to be 3/16 inch (4.76mm) or less, the pad must be replaced ( Figure 6).

warning.para: A jack must never be used alone to support a vehicle while under-chassis service is being performed. The jack may lower and serious personal injury could result. Always support vehicle with floor stands.

note.para: It is recommended that all brake pads on the same axle be replaced at the same time; this will maintain balanced braking of the vehicle.

svcproc.para: Brake pads should not be replaced because of moderate erosion or pitting. This is a normal characteristic of semi-metallic pad lining material. Should erosion reduce the polished contact area by more than 20% of the total contact surface area, replace the pads.
